questions.label: Author of this Label (name, affiliation)
questions.help: This information will show up in the header of the published Label

questions.label: Author Contact Information
What is the relationship between the Label author and the dataset?
People Consulted (name, affiliation)
questions.help: This includes subject matter experts, community advocates, academics, etc.

questions.label: Dataset Title
Provide a short summary of this dataset.
questions.help: Summarize this dataset in a few sentences, including the purpose and contents.

questions.label: Who owns the dataset?
questions.help: List both organization/company and individual when available.

questions.label: Who created the dataset?
questions.help: List both organization/company and individual when available.

questions.label: Who currently maintains the dataset?
questions.help: List both organization/company and individual when available.

questions.label: Provide email address for the maintainer(s).
Indicate which version of the dataset is being described
questions.help: If the dataset has multiple versions, DOI, etc.

questions.label: Is the dataset publicly available?
How can the data be accessed?
questions.help: Indicate access point (such as URL) or method by which data can be accessed.

questions.label: What is the license under which the dataset is made available?
questions.help: If possible, link to license description.

questions.label: When was this dataset created/published?
Indicate up to five keywords relating to this dataset
questions.help: This could include geography, domain, or other characteristics

questions.label: Does the dataset have a metadata repository or data dictionary? If yes, provide the link or access point and if not, explain the features in this dataset.
questions.help: If yes, provide the link and if not, explain the features in this dataset.

questions.label: What is the format of the dataset?
questions.help: For example: csv, txt, etc.

questions.label: How many instances are in the dataset?
questions.help: For example: 10,000 data points, 200 images, etc.

questions.label: Over what timeframe was the data collected?
questions.help: For example, a dataset my be published in 2022 but collected between 2005-2010. If the data continues to be collected, choose "ongoing" for the end date.

questions.label: What was the process of data collection?
What tools, services, or technologies were used to collect the data? If there were multiple steps, please include all.
questions.help: Tools and services would include: software API, hardware apparatus or sensor, app, door-to-door, etc. Also indicate how they were used.

questions.label: Does the dataset include information from upstream sources?
questions.help: Upstream sources can include: other datasets, research papers, tweets, websites, etc.

questions.label: Upload visuals, such as data flow diagrams, that would illustrate the relationship to upstream data.
Will the dataset be updated?
questions.help: For example, to correct labeling errors, add new instances, delete instances, etc.

questions.label: Describe how often, by whom, and how updates will be communicated to users.
Who funds the collection of this data?
questions.help: Include the names of companies, institutions, grant award numbers, etc.

questions.label: Who funds the management of this dataset?
questions.help: Include the names of companies, institutions, grant award numbers, etc.

questions.label: Has the data been reviewed for technical quality?
questions.help: For example: checking for data type consistency, gaps in data completion, etc.

questions.label: Provide access points to any outputs from the technical review.
questions.help: For example, quality reports, a list of quality metrics and expected distributions, etc.

questions.label: Were any ethical review processes conducted?
questions.help: For example: institutional review board approval, internal or third party ethical review process, a report on the potential impact on data subjects, etc.

questions.label: Provide a description of these review processes, including the outcomes, as well as a link or other access point to any supporting documentation.
Does this dataset include information about humans?
Does the dataset identify any subpopulations?
questions.help: For example: age, gender, race or ethnicity, etc.

questions.label: Indicate subpopulation distributions within the dataset where possible.
questions.help: You may upload any visuals that indicate distributions if that is available as well.

questions.label: Does this contain individual-level data?
Does this dataset contain confidential data?
Was consent given by subjects?
How was consent obtained?
questions.help: Describe the consent procedure and provide a link or other access points to any available outputs

questions.label: Within what domain(s) is this intended to be used?
questions.help: Is it specific to a particular domain?

questions.label: What was the original intended use for this dataset?
questions.help: This could include inferences or conclusions from individual instances, as well as models created from trends and correlations in the dataset.

questions.label: Are there other uses, beyond those intended by the dataset producers, for which you could imagine this dataset being used repsonsibly?
questions.help: This could include inferences or conclusions from individual instances, as well as models created from trends and correlations in the dataset.

questions.label: Where and for what purposes has this dataset been used?
questions.help: Provide a description and links to papers or systems that use this dataset.

questions.label: How should this dataset not be used?
questions.help: This could include inferences or conclusions from individual instances, as well as models created from trends and correlations in the dataset.

questions.label: Why not?
questions.help: Including reasoning and cite possible risks.

questions.label: Are there domains or industries in which this dataset should not be used?
Which communities, groups, or identities are represented in this dataset?
Is the dataset made available under certain restrctions?
List restrictions here
questions.help: Include any legal, usage, or license retrictions here.

questions.label: What concerns might you have about extrapolating trends or making generalized inferences from this dataset at a population level?
questions.help: Broader populations could include geographic populations, demographic populations, or other groupings

questions.label: Describe any known mitigation strategies, technical or otherwise, to address the concerns stated above.
questions.help: Mitigation strategies could include data imputation or removal techniques, grouping approaches, or domain-specific knowledge.

questions.label: Are there concerns around using this data to make decisions or predictions at the individual level?
questions.help: Aggregate data may not capture variation across individuals, and therefore decisions made with that data may lack important information. In some cases, this lack of information can make those decisions incomplete, inaccurate, or discriminatory.

questions.label: Describe any known mitigation strategies, technical or otherwise, to address the concerns stated above.
questions.help: Mitigation strategies could include data imputation or removal techniques, grouping approaches, or domain-specific knowledge.

questions.label: Describe any cultural or domain assumptions in data the field definitions that are not made explicit in the data dictionary.
questions.help: This could include: representing information on a continuum in a set of categories, definitions that are domain-specific, grouping multiple categories into one broader category, assuming certain concepts are common knowledge across cultures/domains, etc.

questions.label: Are there any proxy characteristics in this dataset?
questions.help: A proxy characteristic is a variable or field that is implicitly connected to another variable or field, often one that is sensitive or connected to sensitive features (e.g. protected categories such as race, gender, sex).

questions.label: Explain the proxy characteristics.
Did people from the communities, groups, or identities represented in the dataset participate in the process of defining and planning this dataset?
questions.help: This could include the participation of the racial, gender, socioeconomic, and ability, as well as geographic, identities that are represented in the dataset.

questions.label: How were they included?
questions.help: Describe the process through which they participated in the planning and design of this dataset

questions.label: Describe any domain-specific knowledge that is necessary to ensure the dataset is used as intended.
questions.help: This could include knowledge about terms, processes, or strategies for cateogrization that are domain-specific.

questions.label: Is there any content in this dataset that might be sensitive or upsetting?
Describe the sensitive content.
Were there any protocols for collecting and labeling data that required interpretation by individuals or trained systems?
questions.help: This could include categorizing or labeling data manually using a protocol or leveraging a trained system.

questions.label: Describe the protocols.
Did people from the communities, groups or identities represented in the dataset participate in the data collection process?
questions.help: This could include the participation of the racial, gender, socioeconomic, and ability, as well as geographic, identities that are represented in the dataset.

questions.label: How were they included?
questions.help: Describe the process through which they participated in the collection of this data.

questions.label: Are there any other representation issues that might be reflected in the data?
questions.help: In many cases a dataset is a sample that represents a larger population; it is thus important to indicate where undersampling, oversampling, etc. may have taken place.

questions.label: Describe the issue(s)
Describe any protocols followed to impute or fill in missing data, and indicate which fields were affected and in what quantity (%).
Describe any protocols followed to manipulate or adjust existing data, and indicate which fields were affected and in what quantity (%).
questions.help: This includes actions such as cleaning, transforming, grouping data.

questions.label: Describe any data that is missing and the reason, if known.
questions.help: This includes both excluded items and lost data, such as unreadable data, assumed false survey answers, information retrieval malfunction, etc.

questions.label: Was the raw data saved in addition to the preprocessed data?
Provide an access point to the raw data file.
questions.help: Include the URL or API endpoint where the data can be accessed.

questions.label: Provide any access points to documentation of issues related to this dataset.
questions.help: Include the URL or API endpoint where the information can be accessed.

questions.label: Any other concerns or issues with this dataset?
How familiar are you with the intended use of this dataset?
Describe any known issues surrounding the data included in this dataset or how it should be used
questions.help: This includes questions of data field definitions, proxy characteristics, intended or unintended uses

questions.label: How familiar are you with way that this data was collected?
Describe any known issues surrounding how this data was collected
questions.help: This includes questions of: respresentation, sampling, labeling, communities engaged or excluded, any other domain interpretation or knowledge

questions.label: How familiar are you with how this data was cleaned and processed?
Describe any known issues surrounding the way the data was processed
questions.help: This includes questions of: data imputation, manipulation, missing or lost data, or any known errata

questions.label: Is there anything else that someone who is using this data should know about this upstream dataset?
